text: Joseph Henry Kuhns (September, 1800 – November 16, 1883) was a Whig member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Pennsylvania. ==Biography== Joseph H. Kuhns born near Greensburg, Pennsylvania. He graduated from Washington College (later Washington & Jefferson College) in Washington, Pennsylvania, in 1820. He studied law, was admitted to the bar in 1823 and commenced practice in Greensburg. Kuhns was elected as a Whig to the Thirty-second Congress. He was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1852. He resumed the practice of law in Greensburg and died there in 1883. Interment in St. Clair Cemetery. ==Sources== *The Political Graveyard Category:1800 births Category:1883 deaths Category:Washington & Jefferson College alumni Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from Pennsylvania Category:Pennsylvania lawyers Category:Pennsylvania Whigs Category:Whig Party members of the United States House of Representatives Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Joseph Henry Kuhns
